text: You can pull in the dropdown options automatically so that they match the options in the HubDB table. I'm not at my computer at the moment so I don't have the code in front of me, but I can send over how I did it later today.
Is there a way to check for a blog subscription to conditionally show a blog subscription form module/tag?

<@UBUNBSM24> Are you able to pull them in a dropdown field? I think thats what we were referring to. At least thats how I was taking it but I have never been able to get any dropdown fields to pull from hubDB — would love if that were an option!

I'm creating a custom quotes template and the client want to display properties for every user (associated to the deal) in 'contacts' as well as users in another custom CRM object. I used a CRM object field in the module, but that way I have to choose the contact in the templat. Is it possible to loop through all of them so it displays the right content with contacts for the selected deal? 
Sorry for a bad explanation :joy:

I know you can pull it into a dropdown by looping through the field on the page, can you pull it to a dropdown in a module? to make it then filter on the page using that module. EG - you would have a page for option A where the module is added and the code on the page will respond to that and only filter for option A, then another for option B etc.

As far as I know you cannot dynamically set the dropdown values of a module field to match items in a hubDB table.

If youre generating a front-end ui dropdown this is def possible. Or if you need to get the select options in hubl this is possible. But I dont think you can update the actual field with these values. You have to either hardset them to match or just use a text field and have the user match the input up
Oh, no, sorry :blush: I don't think you can use HubL within module fields so you wouldn't be able to have a field in a custom module match HubDb. It needs to be manually added like you said.
you could check to see if the contact is in a list…..and do it that way

I think I’d try looking into the associations of the deal for the contacts — then loop through them?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/hubl/functions#crm-associations>
Thank you! I will look into that
Sorry my question was unclear… Is there a way to show the blog subscription form module only if a portal has blog subscriber notification emails created?
Did some diggin in the developer in – looks like `if group.subscription_lists_by_type` does the trick
I’ll have to check that out — yeah my way wouldn’t be checking that out, are you doing this for a theme?
Looks like I'm busy here today :joy:  is there a way to filter out if a name from a custom object already's displaying from the contact object so it's not showing 2 times?
Yessir! The form has some surrounding markup that was showing when there was no form :grimacing:
